verses.roman:
evaṁ cedi-patī rājā
damaghoṣaḥ sutāya vai
kārayām āsa mantra-jñaiḥ
sarvam abhyudayocitam

synonyms: evam—in the same way; cedi-patiḥ—the lord of Cedi; rājā damaghoṣaḥ—King Damaghoṣa; sutāya—for his son (Śiśupāla); vai—indeed; kārayām āsa—had done; mantra-jñaiḥ—by expert knowers of mantras; sarvam—everything; abhyudaya—to his prosperity; ucitam—conducive.
translation: Rājā Damaghoṣa, lord of Cedi, had also engaged brāhmaṇas expert in chanting mantras to perform all rituals necessary to assure his son's prosperity.
